attributes.action: The UK Parliament shall take the necessary steps to leave the European Union
attributes.additional_details: The historic 23 June 2016 referendum vote resulted in a UK wide majority of votes cast to leave the European Union. With over 33 million votes cast and a majority for leaving of well over a million votes, this should be regarded as a legitimate and final instruction to the UK Parliament to take the UK out of the EU.
attributes.background: On 23rd June in a free and fair referendum it was resolved that the United Kingdom shall leave the European Union. A majority of all UK votes cast was achieved for leaving the EU. It is essential that the will of the people is respected and that the result of the vote is enacted by the UK Parliament
